action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: Starting with a common five-letter word is a good strategy, and I choose a word that has a good mix of vowels and consonants. 
guess: house

attempts = 1
target_word = cubic
guess = house
guess_feedback = h<red> o<red> u<yellow> s<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: h<red> o<red> u<yellow> s<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback shows that "u" is the only letter that appears in the target word, but not in the correct position. My next guess will try to utilize this letter in a different position, and I will choose a new set of letters that are commonly used in English words.
guess: burst

attempts = 2
target_word = cubic
guess = burst
guess_feedback = b<yellow> u<green> r<red> s<red> t<red>

guess_feedback: b<yellow> u<green> r<red> s<red> t<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback indicates that "u" is now in the correct position, and "b" is also present in the target word, but not in the correct position. I will try to keep "u" in the same position and experiment with different positions for "b". I will also introduce new letters that are likely to appear in the target word.
guess: bunch

attempts = 3
target_word = cubic
guess = bunch
guess_feedback = b<yellow> u<green> n<red> c<yellow> h<red>

guess_feedback: b<yellow> u<green> n<red> c<yellow> h<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback shows that "u" remains in the correct position, and "b" and "c" are also present in the target word, but not in the correct positions. I will try to utilize these letters in different positions, and introduce a new letter that is commonly paired with "u" or "c".
guess: cubic

attempts = 4
target_word = cubic
guess = cubic
guess_feedback = c<green> u<green> b<green> i<green> c<green>

guess_explanation: Starting with a common five-letter word is a good strategy, and I choose a word that has a good mix of vowels and consonants.

The feedback shows that "u" is the only letter that appears in the target word, but not in the correct position. My next guess will try to utilize this letter in a different position, and I will choose a new set of letters that are commonly used in English words.

The feedback indicates that "u" is now in the correct position, and "b" is also present in the target word, but not in the correct position. I will try to keep "u" in the same position and experiment with different positions for "b". I will also introduce new letters that are likely to appear in the target word.

The feedback shows that "u" remains in the correct position, and "b" and "c" are also present in the target word, but not in the correct positions. I will try to utilize these letters in different positions, and introduce a new letter that is commonly paired with "u" or "c".
